Clubs.name: UCSD Chess Club
Clubs.description: The club still remains true to its purpose today: to spread campuswide interest in the game of chess as an enjoyable hobby

Clubs.name: Triton Barbell at UCSD
Clubs.description: We welcome anyone to join the team from amateurs to seasoned pros. You must be willing to put in the hard work and time it takes to become stronger, and most importantly be ready to have fun with a unique cast of characters.

Clubs.name: Triton Gaming
Clubs.description: Triton Gaming is UC San Diego's one-stop-shop for all things entertainment, dedicated to creating epic entertainment experiences for all games and gamers.

Clubs.name: SPOT at UCSD
Clubs.description: SPOT for Speech, Physical, AND Occupational Therapy at UCSD, we are excited to incorporate all of the rehabilitation sciences to provide our members with quality speakers, useful workshops, and wholesome fun as a family of interest rehab students

Clubs.name: Anime Club Cal Animage Beta
Clubs.description: We host anime showings Monday evenings starting at 8pm. We also hang out and organize weekend socials like karaoke, club dinner, and Tea Party (anime marathon + potluck). Our largest event is our on-campus con, Animefest, which is taking place this Winter Quarter

Clubs.name: Strides Running Club at UCSD
Clubs.description: Strides is a recreational running club at the University of California, San Diego. Our purpose is to provide a friendly environment to runners of all skill levels--from individuals that are interested in trying out running, to seasoned athletes who seek to improve personal running bests.

Clubs.name: Photography Club at UCSD
Clubs.description: Photo Club is an official UCSD organization, and is a fantastic opportunity to improve your photographic skills and knowledge, providing a venue to challenge those skills, and a forum to share what you have learned with others who have a passion for photography

Clubs.name: Video Game Dev Club @ UCSD
Clubs.description: We’re a member of Triton Gaming, the collective of everything gaming on campus!

Clubs.name: Kaibigang Pilipin@
Clubs.description: KP began as a social gathering for Pilipin@s and Pilipin@-Americans to feel comfortable on campus. Since then, we continue to educate the UCSD and San Diego communities about the many aspects of Pilipin@ culture, as well as to preserve and promote positive images of Pilipin@s.

Clubs.name: Asian & Pacific-Islander Student Alliance
Clubs.description: We, the students of University of California at San Diego (UCSD), come together to provide a forum to deal with the problems and concerns of UCSD Asian and Pacific-Islander (API) students, especially those deemed “underrepresented” by the Student Affirmative Action Committee (SAAC); to try and create an environment where issues such as those political, educational, cultural and social can be addressed; to increase awareness about our API history and heritage within the university and the community; to unite as a community resource to represent a common voice and thereby empower ourselves; and to serve as a support network for building bonds and addressing differences between students

Clubs.name: Alternative Breaks
Clubs.description: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic, or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with quality direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work in.

Clubs.name: Cognitive Science Student Association
Clubs.description: Aid Cognitive Science student body through academic, professional, and social means; Engage graduate population and faculty.

Clubs.name: Circle K. International
Clubs.description: Circle K International is comprised of university students who are responsible citizens and leaders with a lifelong commitment to community service worldwide. Through the three tenets of Service, Leadership, and Fellowship, Circle K inspires people to better our world, following the motto of 'Live to Serve, Love to Serve.' Circle K provides constructive opportunities for students to become involved on their campuses and communities through service work to others in need.

Clubs.name: Fashion Quarterly Magazine
Clubs.description: Fashion Quarterly is UCSD's premier fashion magazine and we are currently in our eighth year running. Every winter and spring quarter, the FQ staff scouts for and features student designers, photographers, stylists, journalists, bloggers, make-up artists, fashion events and major talents via the pages of Fashion Quarterly Magazine which is distributed exclusively at UCSD.

Clubs.name: Flying Sams
Clubs.description: Flying Sams is a medical service club at the University of California, San Diego in association with the non-profit service organization, The Flying Samaritans Inc. We are dedicated to providing free medical services to the underprivileged people of Mexico through a clinic staffed entirely of volunteer physicians, nurses, medical and pre-medical students.

Clubs.name: Global Medical Brigades
Clubs.description: Global Medical Brigades (GMB) is a secular, international network of university clubs that travel to developing countries to perform health care in communities without access to medicine otherwise. GMB delivers a holistic model for sustainable health through rigorous needs assessments, sponsoring referrals to those with needs beyond our capacity, keeping accurate electronic patient records, and working to improve the water and overall public health infrastructures of the villages we serve.

Clubs.name: Health and Medical Professions Preparation Program (HMP3)
Clubs.description: The UCSD Health and Medical Professions Preparation Program (HMP3) provides undergraduates with enriching experiences that will enhance their preparation for admission into professional school in the medical and other health professions. Through collaborations with the UCSD School of Medicine, faculty, community health care providers and others, HMP3 provides members with stimulating experiences designed to expand the mind and increase qualifications for entry into the health professions.

Clubs.name: International Studies Student Association (ISSA) at UCSD
Clubs.description: The International Studies Student Association (also: ISSA) is the official student organization of the International Studies Program (ISP) Department at the University of California, San Diego. The organization gathers like-minded individuals who share diverse interests in international studies and international relations. ISSA intends to provide a platform of rich experiences and opportunities in international studies.

Clubs.name: Movimiento Estudiantil Chicanola de Aztlan (MECHA)
Clubs.description: M.E.Ch.A. is a political voice for UCSD. It takes part in a series of political events through out the year, such as Raza Awareness Week. M.E.Ch.A. also honors many cultural holidays such as El dia de los Muertos and Las Posadas that occur in December; creating an atmosphere for social interaction. M.E.Ch.A. also strives in bridging the gap between High School and College by working directly with the youth of our community. This is accomplished through our annual Raza Youth Empowerment Conference, weekly outreach events, campus tours, overnight programs, and one on one mentoring. In realizing the importance of giving back to the community, we recognize that we are at UCSD to be successful students. We strive to build a community that is strong and united. The year is finalized with our Raza Graduation. Most importantly, throughout the year we build a strong network of people who are currently aware students, activists, and friends.

Clubs.name: Muir Musical
Clubs.description: The Muir Musical is a UCSD student organization that produces one completely student-run musical theatre production annually. Students from all six UCSD colleges are invited to participate in a full-scale Broadway production that marks the single musical theatre opportunity for UCSD students all year long.

Clubs.name: Sun God Archery at UCSD
Clubs.description: The purpose of this organization is to provide the opportunity for UCSD students to compete intercollegiately, and to foster interest and participation in the sport of target archery.

Clubs.name: Tritones at UCSD
Clubs.description: To encourage participation in the fine arts, to provide entertainment, to support all musical endeavors, to expand the genre of a cappella in the San Diego region.

Clubs.name: Surfrider Foundation Club at UCSD
Clubs.description: Surfrider Foundatioin UCSD club is a club that works to keep our local beaches and ocean clean, while also keeping our marine wildlife safe. Members promote a cleaner marine environment that students and faculty alike can enjoy, and inform students about current environmental issues.

Clubs.name: Speech and Debate
Clubs.description: In order for UCSD students to actively compete in speech and debate tournaments in the United States as well as to improve student's communication and argumentative ski
